description: From Latin carminō (“to card, hence to cleanse”), from carmen (“a card for freeing wool or flax from the coarser parts, and from extraneous matter”).

adjectives.description: carminative (comparative more carminative, superlative most carminative)

entries.meaning: Relieving discomfort of gas in the digestive tract.
(medicine) A drug or substance that induces the releasing of gas from the digestive tract.
